name: Le Bernardin
address: 155 W 51st St, New York, NY 10019, USA

reviews.text: We came here to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The service is good but food wasnâ€™t as amazing as I expected. We ordered chefâ€™s tasting menu. Chef balanced the texture and flavor well throughout the courses but no dish feels particularly outstanding. My favorite is shrimp. Bread is simply mediocre.
One of the best restaurants I have ever been to. The food, service and atmosphere all are top notch.

I wanted to like it here but ultimately it fell short of my expectations. The room was noisier than anticipated and I had this sense that I was in a sort of gastronomic factory with an army of waiters flitting about the customers.  I found the service officious and cold.  The overall ambience was dead. Admittedly the prix fixe is cheap at 137 dollars. There are relatively affordable wines by the glass starting at 17 dollars which is good for NYC. However the food left me unimpressed.
Well done ğŸ¥°

The Most DISAPPOINTING 3-Star Restaurant in NYC

My wife and I have always enjoyed Michelin-starred restaurants and rarely been disappointed â€” but Le Bernardin fell short, big time! I canâ€™t believe this is a three-Michelin-star restaurant flooded with 5-star reviews. Do people not understand that Expensive â‰  Good!?

We dined here on a Friday evening around 5:30 p.m. It was quite busy, but we were still warmly greeted. The atmosphere, however, was loud and cramped â€” tables are packed tightly, and servers constantly squeeze by with plates, drinks, utensils, and dirty dishes. It was uncomfortable to sit there with so much chaos around us; I felt like I was at Chelsea Market on a Saturday night. 2 out of 5 for atmosphere.

The major disappointment was the food. Not a single dish met my expectations for a three-star restaurant. Iâ€™ve dined at many 1-, 2-, and 3-star establishments, as well as other top-rated spots, and the food at Le Bernardin tastes like Blue Apron meal kits at best. The dishes lack depth and creativity, with flat, uninspired flavors. You can easily tell the chef assumes that tossing fish, lobster, and caviar into a sauce and slapping on a high price tag will make customers think itâ€™s fine dining. No â€” what a disappointment!

At $500 per person (tax and tip included), this is a total money grab. Donâ€™t come here. The one-star reviews are right â€” those people actually have taste!

Le Bernardin is an exceptional French fine dining restaurant where Chef Eric Ripertâ€™s refined seafood creations truly shine. Despite its Michelin-star prestige, the atmosphere feels relaxed and welcoming â€” even our young child felt completely at ease and enjoyed the experience.

The service was impeccable from start to finish. The staff went above and beyond, pampering us with thoughtful attention and perfectly timed food and drink service.

We chose the three-course prix fixe menu, and every dish was beautifully executed. The appetizer trio offered fresh, flavorful bites of seafood. The bread assortment was among the best weâ€™ve ever had â€” warm, varied, and perfectly baked. For our main courses, the lobster in a rich, aromatic broth and the  steamed Halibut with baby vegetables were both outstanding â€” truly the best halibut weâ€™ve ever tasted.

Desserts, including a decadent chocolate tart and an assortment of small bites, provided the perfect sweet ending to a memorable meal.

Overall, Le Bernardin delivers an extraordinary dining experience â€” refined yet approachable, luxurious yet comfortable. Weâ€™ll definitely return every time weâ€™re in New York.

Went here for dinner with my partner to celebrate our birthdays and 15-year anniversary. One dish arrived cold to the touch, the replacement was overcooked, and although the kitchen sent a complimentary dish to make up for it, we were later charged for it on the bill. The experience took the shine off what was meant to be a special night. I was surprised that a restaurant of this reputation could miss the mark so widely. The overall aesthetic and presentation also felt dated rather than refined.
Wonderful dining experience! Highly recommend the Chefâ€™s Tasting Menu!

It can be tough to get a reservation here, but it's definitely worth the effort! I recommend calculating how far out you can make it and being ready to try as soon as availability opens up online. It's also worth noting that you can do their full tasting menu during lunch hours (this is what we did) if you're having trouble getting dinnertime reservations.
The food, as expected, is all absolutely fantastic. The tasting menu is a tour of seafood and had some truly standout dishes, including the dover solar almondine and the yellowfin tuna carpaccio. I also really enjoyed the dark chocolate tarte dessert. We did the wine pairing with our meal and the wine was a great variety of some unique vintages that paired perfectly with each course. Be warned that the pours are quite generous (this is not a bad thing by any means but come prepared!) and there is one for each of the eight courses so you will definitely be feeling it by the end.

We very much looked forward to a celebratory dinner at Le Bernardin as weâ€™d only ever dined at Le Bernardin for lunch. I believe it was the first truly exceptional restaurant my husband and I enjoyed during the early, lean years of our marriage, so it was high on my list for a very special birthday.

We left overall disappointed in our experience. When you spend a small fortune on a dinner for 2, you expect a degree of care, moments of delightâ€¦above and beyond in experience and wonder. Ours was not that.

Yes, the food was excellent but the meal lacked those spontaneous extras that usually accompany such an experience. Little touches that arenâ€™t on the menu to make the evening special and memorable. We did not receive a birthday greeting upon arrival, despite my husband including a note with the reservation. We also experienced a significant wait for service; other tables that arrived after us were already enjoying champagne before our waiter even brought our menus.  At the end of the meal, they wished us a happy anniversary instead of a happy birthday, getting the celebration wrong.

The pours on our wine tasting were, I hate to use the word but there is no other, remarkably stingy (the table next to ours also did the pairing but seemed to be regulars and while ours were perhaps 3 mouthfuls of wine, their glasses were consistently roughly 1/2 inch more in the glass). The extra dessert was a nice touch, but when they wished us a happy anniversary, it cemented my feeling that neither the occasion nor we were special to the staff or the restaurant.

We thought carefully about our choices for an important dinner for us and Le Bernardin just didnâ€™t meet the moment. A similar meal enjoyed at Palais Royal in Paris on a recent trip was absolutely incredible. We were pampered with so many dizzying extras; service was warm and personal. It felt like a true party in celebration of our mere attendanceâ€¦on a night of true celebration of a momentous day in my life, I just expected more.
Too salty

I sent back the main dish of baked striped bass because it was completely raw ğŸ˜³ as this was the main dish of the harvest lunch set menu in the Lounge I was doubting myself because this is after all under the umbrella of the Le Bernadine which is a 3-Michelin star restaurant.

The waiter took the dish and when he returned he offered no explanation and simply said that it will take a few minutes.

So, I asked if there was indeed an issue.
He said that the chef said that it was indeed a little undercooked ğŸ˜‚

No apology offered.

The food was good quality but nothing special.
The place (the Lounge) was quite empty and a bit cold.

We had such a lovely time at The Lounge at Le Bernardin. We couldn't get a table at the main restaurant as this was a last minute trip to New York unfortunately.  The food at the lounge was still outstanding â€” the skate dish in particular was absolutely perfect, delicate and full of flavor, showcasing the precision and finesse the restaurant is known for.

What truly stood out, though, was the kindness of the team. Even though our sonâ€™s birthday is still a month away, they went out of their way to celebrate him and make him feel special. That thoughtful gesture meant the world to us and turned a wonderful meal into a beautiful family memory.

Thank you to everyone at Le Bernardin for such a warm and memorable experience â€” weâ€™ll treasure it and canâ€™t wait to return! We'll make sur to make a reservation ahead next time to try the main restaurant.

Le Bernardin definitely lives up to its name when it comes to fine dining. The presentation was flawless, the seafood fresh, and every plate told a story detailed, delicate, and intentional. The service matched the elegance, but a few small moments lacked the warmth that makes a high-end experience feel personal.
The atmosphere, though, was on point calm, elevated, and rich with energy. A place that reminds you excellence is in the details.
Louie Kâ€™s Up I donâ€™t chase hype, I capture truth. ğŸ’ğŸ”¥

I have eaten a Le Bernadin on multiple occasions and have typically had a lovely meal.  However, during my last visit this month, even though one of my accompanying guests immediately let the server know about his severe pistachio and cashew allergy upon sitting down, we were all served mignardise with pistachio.  Had my guest not inquired about the ingredients of the suspicious item, the meal would have ended in the emergency room for my guest.  I was really surprised that the servers had not managed that allergy properly; something clearly broke down in the system.  There was also little concern shown when I pointed out the significant mistake.

I am a slim, but voluptuous black woman who went on a date here with a white French man, and we had the vegetarian tasting menu before we went to a show.

The food was excellent and they were accommodating with speeding up the menu so we can make it to our front row Broadway show in time.

But the people at the front desk checking people in, didnâ€™t seem as friendly as I was expecting and seemed to not be that interested in being patient nor accommodating when asking questions about seating or future reservations. For the first time in my life, I felt like I was bothering the staff up upon entering the restaurant although I did nothing wrong and it wasnâ€™t busy at the time. Like he looked down on me or I was guilty of something. It was strange. I didnâ€™t see him being that way with anyone else so I just focused on my dining experience and the food and wasnâ€™t concerned about the staff. I just figured they were judging me or who I was with or what I was wearing although I was dressed classy and covered, but attractive and appear to turn heads which isnâ€™t my fault.

We spent $900 on the bill for 2 and tipped handsomely so assumptions shouldnâ€™t be made fyi.

I will return again to see if my experience will be better because I did love the food and the atmosphere, despite feeling a little unwelcome by staff.

Every single dish was amazing! Too many courses that I lost count. I wish it was proper to ask for a whole 8" plate of their tiny portions, but that would be weird and waaay out of our budget. Cocktails are perfect. Left full & satisfied. Service is as-expected for the type of establishment. Interior and decor are a bit dated and dark. It is well-maintained and clean which is what matters most.  Overall, we would love to visit again.

The most incredible part was the service. It felt like dining inside a play or production that you were somehow part of. Everything was so perfectly orchestrated, from the timing to the details. It almost felt scripted. I assume it kind of is, and theyâ€™re just absolute masters at their craft. Iâ€™ll be talking about this meal for a very long time.

Date of visit: 8/8/25

Went for our wedding anniversary. Ordered the Chef tasting, we didn't order the wine pairing as we don't drink. All dishes were great especially the Tuna. The best lemonade I've ever tasted. Service was impeccable. As regular New Yorkers, price is steep, maybe eat here once in a lifetime for a very special occasion. If you're traveling to NYC, this is worth a romantic visit. Book a month in advance as slots fill up quick.

I was really disappointed in the tasting menu. While the desserts were superb, all of the other courses just fell completely flat or made really odd choices.

The lobster, for example. It was cooked perfectly, and pre-cut and assembled back together beautifully on the plate, but the broth just absolutely ruined it. The â€œspiced citrus brothâ€ was so strong and one-note that it completely buried the flavor of the lobster. And if I ate the lobster without the broth, it was under-seasoned and therefore not great on its own even though I could finally taste lobster.

I felt the shrimp cup â€œshellfish medleyâ€ with the dashi custard was just confusing. There was so much going on there competing with each other that it just seemed odd. The shrimp, the uni, the custard, the 1/2 tablespoon of shellfish broth - it all just â€œate dirtyâ€.

The tuna (first course) had no flavor at all. All the flavor was in the biscuit and foie gras.

While everything was visually impressive and sufficiently fussy, the lack of (and competing) flavors made this a really disappointing meal, and certainly not what I would expect from a three (or even one) Michelin star place.

Unfortunately Iâ€™ll remember nothing from this meal. Nothing stood out at all. Just very bland and flat, and with a service staff that (aside from one or two people) seemed less than thrilled to be there.

This is a French seafood restaurant that is about as good as a French seafood restaurant can be.  Donâ€™t expect to encounter anything crazy or mind-blowingly original. It is not avant-guard. It is awesome.

Of course the service is killer. Everyone is so easy to talk too. The somms are great no matter your budget.

As a strange habit I have a tendency to focus in on the acoustics of a restaurant. Le Bern has great acoustics. Despite the size of the room, the sound of the place is serene - what would be loud voices or sharp noises in most restaurants get damped down almost as if your table is surrounded by some noise  cancelling device.

Professional Tip:
How to get in without a reservation: Just ask to be seated in the Lounge where they only serve walk-ins. I feel like Iâ€™m giving away a secret here.

It never seems to fill up and everything available in the main room is available here (plus the short â€œLounge menuâ€).

The restaurant for some reason seems to downplay the Lounge to the point the hours are not posted anywhere I can find on their website. Iâ€™ve only been for lunch when they open at 12.  Iâ€™m not sure if they are open for dinner . . .

I wear jeans and a nice shirt because thereâ€™s no dress code in the Lounge, though the friendly coat check staff (on the immediate left at the entrance) have blue blazers of all sizes for you to check out if you feel the need.

We made reservations for Thursday, October 9th, 2025 at 12pm and both chose the Lunch Three Course Prix Frixe. The server was exceptional at explaining the menu options and he was very attentive. The service overall exceedingly made our first time there one to remember. The food was beyond anything we've both experienced and definitely savored every moment of our meal. The dessert was outstandingly perfection. We did add on an additional dessert "The Egg" and we're glad we did. Service from beginning to end was stellar. We tried non-alcoholic beverages Lychee Nectar and Raspberry Nectar both were very refreshing and perfectly sweet. We enjoyed our first experience at Le Bernardin. Will definitely revisit in the near future.

Le Bernardin is undeserving of its 3-Michelin star rating and legendary status. We dined on Friday 10/10/25 10:15pm reservation. The moment we entered the dining room, it was very busy. The hallmark of a fine dining establishment is that the staff only needs to make its presence known when itâ€™s needed; otherwise, stay away. Itâ€™s not Dennyâ€™s when you see the dirty plates being whisked up and down the dining room. But thatâ€™s only a small part of the issue. One busgirl had an RBF the entire evening. The server who took our order was perfunctory at best. No warmth whatsoever. When our friend went to the restroom, the same server still decided to serve the next course and proceeded to cover the plate with a bowlâ€”THAT DOESNT EVEN COVER THE ENTIRE PLATE (like, whatâ€™s the point?!). To me, thatâ€™s a cardinal sin. The same server never stopped by to inform us that he had to clock out and another server would take over. The whole evening was a hot mess. We will not return.
Good food and service. Wear sleeves
The Lounge is a great option if you are not looking for a full meal.

Went for lunch several weeks ago. Food was very good, not revolutionary or particularly interesting, but still the best cooked piece of salmon in the entire city.

Service was a huge letdown. We did not skimp, including having a very nice bottle of wine. Staff only seemed interested in interacting with regulars. Petit fours were slammed down on the table at the end of the meal without explanation. Had to wave down someone to ask for coffee. Does not live up to the service standard at other 3 star restaurants in the city. Nor is this the "aloof" French style service other reviewers have lauded.

Would not go back or recommend. Much better places in the city both for value, innovation, and service.
Esperienza sempre ai massimi livelli
GerÃ§ek bir ÅŸey restorantÄ± New Yorkâ€™a gelip de evet buraya uÄŸramadan geÃ§meyin
I had the City Harvest Menu on the Bar Lounge. It was a 3 course menu with delicious choices. A perfect Lunch! The fish was fresh and delicious and the service was impeccable.
Very nice just wish we could have spent more time at the table....tiny tiny feeling of being rushed

First VISIT back in quite some time, elegant room with amazing seafood dishes, and top-notch French service, a little bit crisp I would add. Enjoyed everything we ate and had a terrific, expensive evening here.
3 Michelin stars say all you need to know

The service here is unquestionably top-tier, and the atmosphere is lovelyâ€”albeit a bit louder than I expected. â€œOk, just okâ€ is the best way to describe the food. Many of the dishes on the tasting menu felt less imaginative than one might expect from a three-Michelin-starred restaurant.

Of particular note, the Peruvian dark chocolate dessert was almost unbearably sweet and lacked complexity. The carrot cake, on the other hand, was a far more suitable conclusion to a long tasting menu. The bread service was disappointingâ€”it was served at room temperature, and the baguette was so firm that it bordered on stale.

Additionally, most of the plates used throughout the tasting menu were identical and showed numerous visible scratches, which came across as uninspired. This issue extended to the silverware as well, detracting from the overall fine-dining experience.

Overall, we felt that Le Bernardin did not quite deliver the value expected from a bill exceeding $1,000, though it remained a pleasant and memorable experience nonetheless.
Food was delicious. We got the 3-course menu. The portion is quite generous.
Simply just perfect. Love that living legend is touching tables to greet VIPs and making sure that guests are enjoying to the fullest.

A decent Michelin 3-Star restaurant!
Price is reasonable and the food was presented with ideas and thoughts.
Can reserve in a week if you donâ€™t mind eating late.
Amazing food , great service but a bite fast for a full course dinner , expresso martini not great.

yeah i expected much more but the food is mid, i sat at the front of the entrance on the right side so ambiente was not so good either only thing good was the service,  i had the chefâ€˜s tasting menu

I had high expectations for this restaurant given its reputation, but unfortunately, the service fell far short from the start. The hostess seemed disinterested in welcoming usâ€”no smile, no warmthâ€”which set a poor tone for the evening.

After being seated, we ordered a glass of champagne and expressed our intent to order a bottle of wine to pair with the chefâ€™s tasting menu. We were told the sommelier would be by to assist us. We waited for approximately 20 minutes (by which time our first course arrived), but by then the lack of attention made us feel overlooked and under appreciated so we chose not to order a bottle of wine at all.

The service otherwise met basic expectations for a three-star restaurant, but failed to impress in a way as do places like French Laundry or Piazza Duomo. The food was very good, but not exceptional. Perhaps like a bad first bite, the taste in our mouth from the initial experience tainted the evening. For a place with such a storied reputation, I expected an exceptional and memorable evening, but instead left feeling disappointed.
Finest dining experience!!  Exquisite!!
Very special experience

Absolutely an excellent day and wish this for anyone in New York who enjoy flavours ğŸ¤ŒğŸ¼

Disappointment is never in the dictionary. Every small details were not missed by the staffs. Old fashion is smooth and the lobster were so fresh and delicate I dont have words to actually describe it.

The accolade is well deserved.

Dined here last night with my husband to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We both truly enjoy spending money on experiences and good food, especially culinary experiences that you canâ€™t get anywhere else. The food was magnificent. Every bite surprised me. All the flavors went very well together and I wouldnâ€™t change anything about any of the dishes. Each bite was different but similar. And the flavors were truly dancing on my tongue. 10/10 culinary experience.

For a resturaunt of that reputation, youâ€™d expect the service to be first class. But the service did not meet our expectations compared to other resturaunts of the same category. The servers did not have a genuine sense of hospitality. When switching out the silverware after every course, the servers just barged between us in the middle of conversation, and plopped the silverware down on the table. Reaching their arm right in our faces, without an ounce of respect. Even I would say â€œexcuse meâ€ if I was that close to someoneâ€™s face and Iâ€™m not a trained waitstaff at a Michelin star resturaunt.
Another note to mention- we were completly unaware that the bread service was unlimited and of constant supply throughout the dinner. After finishing out bread, the empty plates were crowding our table, along with our used lemon wedges, so we decided to ask one of the multiple waiters who were coming to our table to remove the plates (so that the table seemed a bit more tidy). He seemed shocked but took the plates away. After 20 minutes, we see the bread server walking around with the bread basket, handing out more bread to other tables which THEN made us realize that the bread service was constant and not just given after the appetizer. We politely asked if we could try some more bread, and the waiter looked extremely taken aback, reminded us that we asked for the bread plates to be taken away, made a face, seemed to roll his eyes and had a mouthful of words before giving us the plates back. He kept commenting that â€œyou were the ones who asked for the plates to be removed, that means you donâ€™t want anymore bread!â€ With extreme attitude! At this moment, I felt disrespected and calmly said â€œwe were not made aware that the bread service was constantâ€ and while I was saying that, he was still making comments, I had to speak over him. I didnâ€™t even hear what he kept saying. But I was so shocked that he made such a scene about giving us the bread plates back. Before even taking away the plates, he could have informed us that if he takes the plates away, it meant that we didnâ€™t want bread. This was our fist time dining there. We werenâ€™t made aware of the rules. And this experience truly upset me a bit.

When you spend this much money on a resturaunt, you expect high quality food along with high quality hospitality. The service was average and my experience with that one particular waiter made me give the service 3 stars. The other staff were nice. But not a single waiter has the habit of saying â€œexcuse meâ€ before putting silverware down right in front of your face.

The ambiance was average. Nothing special. Looked like a regular resturaunt which is why Iâ€™m giving 3 stars to that. I guess, going to another 3-Michelin star resturaunt in NYC really set the bar high for me in terms of ambiance and service (which directly contribute to your dining experience)

Overall, the food itself is enough to dine there and spend the money. We did the chefs tasting menu but you can also choose a 4 course option which is cheaper. We decided to go all out during this first visit. I am a huge foodie and I truly took time to savor every bite and dissect the flavors and I will say that every bite of the same dish is so different but similar, and it was incredibly delicious.

It's always so good to know that I can count on this place to remain the same even after a decade. The professionalism combined with a welcome approach is hard to forget. We've experienced many fine places that have simply declined throughout the years but Le Bernardino continues to exceed our expectations. Warm friendly service, superb cuisine, excellent wines and then of course an atmosphere of elegance to top it off. If you are looking for a special place to celebrate as we're over ten years ago and now again, and you are looking forward to the the establishment meeting your vision of upscale everything, then this is the place. Thank you Le Bernardin for making our anniversary extra special.
This was just fantastic and amazing. The food was exquisite and the service was impeccable. Cannot recommend highly enough.

Dining at Le Bernardin was nothing short of extraordinary. From the moment we were seated, the service was polished, warm, and attentiveâ€”every detail thoughtfully curated. Each course was beautifully presented and even more delightful on the palate. The lobster was, without exaggeration, the best Iâ€™ve ever hadâ€”perfectly tender and delicately flavored.

To top off an already flawless evening, the chef surprised me with a complimentary carrot cake to celebrate my birthday, which was such a lovely and thoughtful gesture. The ambiance was sophisticated yet intimate, making the entire evening feel truly special.

10/10â€”perfection from start to finish.
Another exceptional experience after 9 years from the first visit. Everything tasted great and service was top notch.
Carlos and Miguel were amazing!

My husband and I celebrated our first wedding anniversary at Le Bernardin, and it was truly unforgettable â¤ï¸
From the moment we arrived, everything felt so elegant yet full of heart. The space was beautiful, with fresh flowers everywhere, and we were seated at the most charming corner table. My husband sat facing a gorgeous painting, and I had a lovely view of the room â€” it felt so intimate and special, like the city paused just for us.

The service was beyond gracious. When they found out we were celebrating, they brought out a surprise dessert, and it meant so much to us. Every little detail was thoughtful and warm.

And the foodâ€¦ absolutely divine. Every dish was a masterpiece â€” refined, delicate, full of flavor, and simply unforgettable. Itâ€™s no surprise theyâ€™ve earned three Michelin stars â€” every bite reminded us why. We kept smiling through each course, completely blown away.

It was the perfect place to celebrate love. Romantic, classic, and full of magic. Weâ€™ll treasure this evening forever!

I visited Le Bernardin with friends to celebrate my birthday. The food was delicious â€” fresh ingredients, elegant presentation, and everything tasted great.

However, there were a few things that left me disappointed, especially considering the high-end reputation of the restaurant. First, I had informed the staff in advance that one of my guests had a black caviar allergy and requested a substitution. Unfortunately, the dish was served to him without the caviar, but instead of offering a replacement, they simply placed the caviar in the middle of the table, which felt careless.

Second, we had mentioned in our reservation that we were celebrating my birthday. When the server brought out the birthday cake with a candle, she approached my friends instead of me. Even after we pointed out that I was the one celebrating, she just placed the cake on the other side of the table. That felt a bit disappointing, especially at a fine dining restaurant where attention to detail should be top-notch.

Overall, the food was excellent, but the service did not meet expectations. I hope this was just an off night and not a reflection of their usual standard
